sources.title: Idaho Kid
sources.description: For any surviving Rex Bell fans out there, he stars as the long-lost son of a ruthless cattle baron in this low-impact B-western with more plot than action. Good supporting cast and adequate production values. An entertaining oater that wonâ€™t raise your blood pressure. IMDB rating 6.4. Directed by Robert Hill Released in 1936. Complete print. CAST NOTE: Rex Bell may not have been the greatest on-screen hero, but off-screen he was the cowboy who finally tamed Clara Bow by marrying her.

sources.title: Idaho Kid (1936) REX BELL
sources.description:
Stars: Rex Bell, Marion Shilling, David Sharpe 
 Director: Robert F. Hill

 Idaho, returning to the area he left as a boy, gets in the middle of a range feud. He takes the side of Endicott. On the other side is Hollister who is unaware that Idaho is his long lost son.

metadata.Plot: Idaho, returning to the area he left as a boy, gets in the middle of a range feud. He takes the side of Endicott. On the other side is Hollister who is unaware that Idaho is his long lost son.
metadata.Writer: Paul Evan Lehman, George H. Plympton
metadata.Actors: Rex Bell, Marion Shilling, David Sharpe
